paper_abstract: This paper deals with the exponential stability of a class of nonlinear delay-integro-differential equations of the form (x)over dot(t) = f(t, x(t), x(t-tau(1)(t)), integral(t)(t-tau 2(t))g(t, s, x(s))ds), t >= t0, where tau(i)(t) > 0 for i = 1, 2 and t >= t(0). The stability relation between ordinary and delay-integro-differential equations is given. It is shown under some suitable conditions that a delay-integro-differential equation will remain exponential stability of the corresponding ordinary differential equation. Finally, some examples with numerical experiments illustrate the theoretical result. (C) 2008 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: The stability relation between ordinary and delay-integro-differential equations
